issue.title: Document requirements of active scan rules

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
From OWASP ZAP User Group: https://groups.google.com/d/topic/zaproxy-users/AlT3gpxale8/discussion

---

Document, in the help pages, what are the requirements of each scanner to effectively scan.
Some of the scanners might run but not do any scanning (e.g. send requests), for example:
- [Session Fixation](https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/blob/0539215586369d676ce5e740c3616530db03286a/src/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/ascanrulesBeta/SessionFixation.java), will not scan [unless there's a context with form-based authentication](https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/blob/0539215586369d676ce5e740c3616530db03286a/src/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/ascanrulesBeta/SessionFixation.java#L133-L164) (to obtain the login URL);
- [XML External Entity Attack](https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/blob/ce47ebd74d69e6caee5a6725a855c531f3f2ddfc/src/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/ascanrulesBeta/XXEPlugin.java), will not scan if the [Content-Type of the request does not contain XML](https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/blob/ce47ebd74d69e6caee5a6725a855c531f3f2ddfc/src/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/ascanrulesBeta/XXEPlugin.java#L233);
- [Generic Padding Oracle](https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/blob/ce47ebd74d69e6caee5a6725a855c531f3f2ddfc/src/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/ascanrulesBeta/PaddingOraclePlugin.java), will not scan if the values of the parameters being attacked [do not look to be encrypted](https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/blob/ce47ebd74d69e6caee5a6725a855c531f3f2ddfc/src/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/ascanrulesBeta/PaddingOraclePlugin.java#L166) or do not match [some](https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/blob/ce47ebd74d69e6caee5a6725a855c531f3f2ddfc/src/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/ascanrulesBeta/PaddingOraclePlugin.java#L316) [patterns](https://github.com/zaproxy/zap-extensions/blob/ce47ebd74d69e6caee5a6725a855c531f3f2ddfc/src/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/ascanrulesBeta/PaddingOraclePlugin.java#L341).

(The above is not an exhaustive enumeration of the active scanners that need to be documented.)

body: In my case, the only DB tech I had enabled was MySQL. But strangely, it seemed like sometimes it would run, and sometimes it would not. So, I'm kind of wondering if having something else disabled somewhere was actually the cause. But really have no idea.
Were the techs defined in the context or the Active Scan dialogue?

I used the Active Scan dialog to set the policy AND tune the Technologies to try to make the scan faster by disabling everything I thought was not relevant. The only techs I left ON were: MySQL, MacOS, and Tomcat. I turned off everything else I'm pretty sure.

issue.title: Provide the reason why scanners were skipped

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change class HostProcess to allow to specify (and obtain) the reason why
a scanner was skipped, to specify the reason why the scanner was skipped
when it does not target the selected technologies and to log the reason
when the scanner finishes (if available).
Change class ScanProgressItem to set a reason when the scanner is
skipped by user action.
Change ScanProgressActionIcon to show the reason why a scanner was
skipped (in the tool tip text of the skipped icon), also include the
reason when copying the scanners progress to the clip board.

Fix #2415 - Show the reason why an active scanner was skipped

body: OK, for the SQLi scanner it might be because of an issue (fixed in zaproxy/zap-extensions#439).

issue.title: Provide skip reason for Script Active Scan Rules

milestone.description: Enhancements and bug fixes expected to be included in the next main release.

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Change class ScriptsActiveScanner to provide the reason why the scanner
is skipped (simply, when there are no Script Rules enabled).

Related to issues:
- #2221 - Skip "Script Active Scan Rules" scanner if there are no
  scripts enabled;
- #2415 - Show the reason why an active scanner was skipped.

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
